author: Yahoo News UK
title: Holidaymaker could lose his whole FOOT after 'innocuous' cut from hotel swimming pool
text:
View photos
WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT
A British tourist is facing the prospect of losing his entire foot after cutting it on the bottom of a Caribbean hotel pool.
Five months after what appeared to be a minor injury on holiday, Stewart Vine has already had his little toe and part of his left foot amputated, forcing him to give up work as a finance manager.
And he has now been warned he may need to have his entire foot removed.
Stewart was on a £2,500 week-long British Airways package to Antigua with wife Sarah when he cut his foot on a sharp object in the bottom of the pool at the three-star Jolly Beach Hotel.
View photos
Infection – it’s thought that Stewart developed a huge infection from his seemingly innocuous cut in the swimming pool (Pictures: SWNS) More The 55-year-old, from Cullercoats, North Tyneside, said: “I was in the pool and cut my foot on something. I thought it was very innocent.
“I got out of the pool and didn’t think it was that serious. It was just a scrape, it wasn’t a deep cut. It was fairly innocuous.”

MORE: Sugar levels ‘still too high’ in children’s cereals despite reduction of salt
Stewart put antiseptic cream on the open wound and thought nothing more of it until two days later when he came down with a fever during a romantic meal with Sarah and collapsed in their hotel room.
Despite his condition he said he felt well enough to board the flight home two days later, taking paracetamol to ease the pain.
View photos
Amputation – doctors said they had no choice but to remove Stewart’s little toe and part of his foot More But on board, he began to vomit and have what his wife thought was some sort of seizure.
The couple say Stewart had to be given oxygen during the flight and part of the medical equipment indicated he had a major infection.
Back at home he was treated at various hospitals, resulting in doctors saying they had no option but to amputate his little toe and part of his left foot.
Stewart added: “I’ve now lost my job through all this. The experience has affected us massively and we don’t want to fly anymore. There is still a chance I could lose my foot.”
View photos
Upset – the couple feel they have been robbed of their love of holidays More Sarah said: We have always loved our holidays, that’s what we work so hard for but I feel like we have had that taken away from us.
The couple are now planning to take legal action.
British Airways said: “We are very sorry to hear that Mr Vine has been so unwell following his injury and are speaking to him while we investigate his concerns.”
The Jolly Beach Hotel has been contacted for comment.
